str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.
Worthy, worthy of, deserving, comparable, suitable. Probably from ago; deserving, comparable or suitable.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).
And, even, also, namely.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: Himself, herself, itself.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
This; he, she, it.
A stone; met: of Jesus as the chief stone in a building. Apparently a primary word; a stone.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
(a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
Abraham, progenitor of the Hebrew race. Of Hebrew origin; Abraham, the Hebrew patriarch.
